com.srch2.android.http.service

Class IndexDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.IndexDescription

  • public final class IndexDescription
extends Object
    Creates the necessary configuration for each index that will be searchable in the SRCH2 search server. Each index in the SRCH2 search server requires a name and a schema which is defined in the construction of this class.

    The only place construction of an object of this class should occur is in the Indexable implementation of the abstract method public IndexDescription getIndexDescription() when returning from this method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates the necessary configuration for the index that the Indexable implementation represents.
      IndexDescription(String name, Field primaryKeyField, String latitudeFieldName, String longitudeFieldName, Field... remainingField)
      Creates the necessary configuration for the index that the Indexable implementation represents for an index that includes geo-search capability.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexDescription

        public IndexDescription(String name,
                Field primaryKeyField,
                Field... remainingField)
        Creates the necessary configuration for the index that the Indexable implementation represents. Should only be constructed when returning from the Indexable method getIndexDescription().

        The first argument should always be the name of the index. The value of this can be used to reference the index when the static method calls of the SRCH2Engine are used to request a task on an index (instead of using the non-static methods of the Indexable); or it can also be used to identify which set of search results belong to which indexes when the SearchResultsListener method onNewSearchResultsAvailable() is triggered. Thus it is recommended that this value be kept in a constant field in the Indexable class implementation.

        The second argument should always be the primary key field, which can be used to retrieve a specific record or as the handle to delete the record from the index. Each record should have a unique value for its primary key.

        The remaining set of arguments are the rest of the schema's fields as they are defined for the index. They can be passed in any order.

        This method will throw exceptions if name is null or empty; or if any of the fields passed are null.
        Parameters:
        name - the value to assign to name the index
        primaryKeyField - the field which will be the primary key of the index's schema
        remainingField - the set of any other fields needed to define the schema

      • IndexDescription

        public IndexDescription(String name,
                Field primaryKeyField,
                String latitudeFieldName,
                String longitudeFieldName,
                Field... remainingField)
        Creates the necessary configuration for the index that the Indexable implementation represents for an index that includes geo-search capability. Should only be constructed when returning from the Indexable method getIndexDescription().

        The first argument should always be the name of the index. The value of this can be used to reference the index when the static method calls of the SRCH2Engine are used to request a task on an index (instead of using the non-static methods of the Indexable); or it can also be used to identify which set of search results belong to which indexes when the SearchResultsListener method onNewSearchResultsAvailable() is triggered. Thus it is recommended that this value be kept in a constant field in the Indexable class implementation.

        The second argument should always be the primary key field, which can be used to retrieve a specific record or as the handle to delete the record from the index. Each record should have a unique value for its primary key.

        The third and fourth arguments should always be the latitude and longitude fields, in that order, that are defined for the index's schema. The remaining set of arguments are the rest of the schema's fields as they are defined for the index. They can be passed in any order.

        This method will throw exceptions if name is null or empty; or if any of the fields passed are null.
        Parameters:
        name - the value to assign to name the index
        primaryKeyField - the field which will be the primary key of the index's schema
        latitudeFieldName - the field which will be the latitude field of the index's schema
        longitudeFieldName - the field which will be the longitude field of the index's schema
        remainingField - the set of any other fields needed to define the schema

    • Method Detail

      • setQueryTermSimilarityThreshold

        public void setQueryTermSimilarityThreshold(float threshold)
        Set the default fuzziness similarity threshold. This will determine how many character substitutions the original search input will match search results for: if set to 0.5, the search performed will include results as if half of the characters of the original search input were replaced by wild card characters.

        Note: In the the formation of a Query, each Term can have its own fuzziness similarity threshold value set by calling the method enableFuzzyMatching(Float value); by default it is disabled for terms.

        This will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the value of threshold is less than zero or greater than one.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the similarity ratio to match against

      • setTopK

        public void setTopK(int numberOfResultsToReturn)
        Sets the number of search results to be returned per query or search task.

        This method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the value of numberOfResultsToReturn is less than one
        Parameters:
        numberOfResultsToReturn - the number of results to return per search

      • getIndexName

        public String getIndexName()
        Gets the name of the index this Indexable represents as it was set in the IndexDescription returned in the Indexable implementation of getIndexDescription(). This can be used to call the static CRUD methods of the SRCH2Engine and used to identify which index the two callbacks StateResponseListener and SearchResultsListener refer to in their callback methods.
        Returns:
        the name of the index this Indexable represents
